text: Nancy Walker Bush Ellis (February 4, 1926 â€“ January 10, 2021) was an American environmentalist and political campaigner. Bush Ellis was born in Milton, Massachusetts. She was the only sister of former U.S. President George H. W. Bush, and aunt of both former President George W. Bush and the former governor of Florida John Ellis "Jeb" Bush. Although she had been a liberal Democrat and an environmentalist.Pact Board of Directors biographies , accessed July 15, 2008 She joined the Republican Party in 1988 when her brother ran for president.Kitty Kelley, The Family: The Real Story of the Bush Dynasty, Random House, 2004. Ellis was hospitalized on December 30, 2020 from COVID-19 in Concord, Massachusetts. She died on January 10, 2021 at an assisted living facility from the infection, aged 94. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Massachusetts Category:American environmentalists Category:Bush family Category:People from Milton, Massachusetts
title: Nancy Walker Bush Ellis
